status.name: Closed

fields.description: As a cloud user, I want a view of the scaling groups landing page that will size well to different devices and show me information in a clear, easy to understand view without using tables.

comments.body:
The front-end for the Scaling Groups landing page is complete in the 4.0 console, both for the tile and table view.

Just need to wire it up with the Euca and AWS backends, since the current data fetch uses mock items.

The Scaling Groups landing page template is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/blob/develop/koala/templates/scalinggroups/scalinggroups.pt
Getting an unauthorized error fetching Scaling groups from clchost 10.111.1.16
Fixed connection error by downgrading to boto 2.13.3.  [~dkavanagh] is investigating what changed w.r.t. more recent boto versions.

* filters are not implemented as per wireframe design (see comment wrt filters below)
* filters don't collapse when under smallest breakpoint (see comment wrt filters below)
* search bar watermark text says "filter" but should be blank (done)
* no "save as default" (star button) available for filters (handled via browser bookmarks)
* scaling group actions missing from dropdown (done)
* sort missing dropdown caret indicator (done)
* no help button or help display (separate ticket)
* no 2-letter indicators on properties view (done)
* properties shows AZ when it shouldn't, is missing current instance count, desired instance count, and instance health (counts and health status done)
* table view: same comments, and filters not implemented off canvas to make room for additional columns (see comment wrt filters below)
* table view: missing actions selector (done)

Could we confirm if we need filters for the scaling groups landing page?  Implementing filters is a fairly involved effort, and I want to confirm that the number of scaling groups will justify requiring filters.

[~kgill] I will gather some data to help us determine whether we can push filters for this page into a follow-on release. At the very least, for now put implementing filters for this page at the bottom of your filter implementation to-do list, as my gut instinct tells me it will be OK to push them for this page. Please stand by for more info!
[~kgill], confirmed with [~shashi] that we can push the filters for the scaling groups landing page to 4.1 if we run out of time in 4.0. Thanks, and good luck!

* displayed properties do not match wireframe at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Manage+Scaling+Groups+Landing (do not include scaling activity sparkline, that wasn't implemented in 3.x either). The columns in the table there are the ones that should be in the table/tiles for 4.0. The info in the expandos can go on the detail page.

[~kgill], can the breadcrumbs here be home > Auto Scaling (not a link) > Scaling groups or Launch configurations depending on what tab you are on? Right now the breadcrumbs are inconsistent between the two tabs, and also are redundant with the tab selector below. 

So, they would be <home icon> > Auto Scaling (not a link) > Scaling groups (not a link)

and

<home icon> > Auto Scaling (not a link) > Launch configurations (not a link)

[~jloza] Hmm, It seems odd to have a few of the items in the breadcrumbs not be links.  Also, we should keep the sub-nav links IMO since they complement the breadcrumbs.

I'm sure you're aware of best practices in implementing breadcrumbs, but I'll reference them here anyway...
- http://ui-patterns.com/patterns/Breadcrumbs 
- http://www.smashingmagazine.com/2009/03/17/breadcrumbs-in-web-design-examples-and-best-practices-2/
[~kgill] yeah. this is a little weird though because we don't have a autoscaling page to link to. We can't have links to things that don't exist.

We could leave out the autoscaling part from the breadcrumb but i think that is less helpful because groups and configs are its babies, even though there's not a page for that. :) Motherless babies make people sad.

Motherless babies do make people sad, but breadcrumb items that aren't links also make people sad. :-)

I'm not convinced we need to surface 'Auto Scaling' as a parent item for scaling groups and launch configs.  Launch configurations only make sense in the context of scaling groups, which is why (I think) we link the "Auto Scaling Groups" top nav item to scaling groups and why the only way to get to the Launch configs landing page is via the scaling groups page.

Every breadcrumb pattern and implementation I've seen has links for each item in the breadcrumb.  We should avoid including items in breadcrumbs unless they are linkable.

[~kgill] I'll call you tomorrow and we can work on this together. You are correct as to why the launch configs are not in the top nav, so we just need to make this make sense in the breadcrumb world as well without having redundant linkage.

Reworked nav and breadcrumbs to accommodate AutoScaling changes.
https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/123

Note: the nav bar wraps and causes the breadcrumbs to jump to the right below a certain threshold due to the number of items in the top nav.  I've removed "Dashboard" from the nav to buy additional real estate, but we're still seeing the "ghost wrapping" behavior below a certain breakpoint.  Call me if you need to discuss.
[~kgill] I filed a separate bug for the nav thing, and moved this ticket into In QA. Thanks for all your hard work!
